info.ephyra.util
Class StringUtils

java.lang.Object
  info.ephyra.util.StringUtils

public class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of utilities for string processing.

Version:
2007-05-05
Author:
Nico Schlaefer

isSubset

private static boolean isSubset(java.lang.String[] tokens1,
                                java.lang.String[] tokens2)
Checks if the first array of tokens is a subset if the second array.

Parameters:
tokens1 - token array 1
tokens2 - token array 2
Returns:
true, iff ss1 is a subset of ss2

isSubset

public static boolean isSubset(java.lang.String s1,
                               java.lang.String s2)
Checks if the tokens in the first string form a subset of the tokens in the second string.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the tokens in s1 are a subset of the tokens in s2

isSubsetKeywords

public static boolean isSubsetKeywords(java.lang.String s1,
                                       java.lang.String s2)
Checks if the tokens in the first string form a subset of the tokens in the second string. Function words and tokens of length less than 2 are ignored.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the keywords in s1 are a subset of the tokens in s2

Normalizes a string. Similar strings are mapped to equal normalizations.

Parameters:

Returns:
normalized string

equalsNorm

public static boolean equalsNorm(java.lang.String s1,
                                 java.lang.String s2)
Compares the normalizations of the two strings, using the standard String.equals() method.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the normalizations are equal

equalsSubset

public static boolean equalsSubset(java.lang.String s1,
                                   java.lang.String s2)
Compares two strings. The strings are considered equal, iff one of the strings is a subset of the other string, i.e. iff all the tokens in the one string also occur in the other string.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the strings are equal in the sense defined above

equalsSubsetNorm

public static boolean equalsSubsetNorm(java.lang.String s1,
                                       java.lang.String s2)
Compares the normalizations of the two strings, using the equalsSubset() method.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the normalizations are equal

equalsIntersect

public static boolean equalsIntersect(java.lang.String s1,
                                      java.lang.String s2)
Compares two strings. The strings are considered equal, iff the number of words that occur in both strings over the total number of words is at least INTERSECT_FRAC.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the strings are equal in the sense defined above

equalsIntersectNorm

public static boolean equalsIntersectNorm(java.lang.String s1,
                                          java.lang.String s2)
Compares the normalizations of the two strings, using the equalsIntersect() method.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the normalizations are equal

equalsCommon

public static boolean equalsCommon(java.lang.String s1,
                                   java.lang.String s2)
Compares two strings. The strings are considered equal, iff they have a common token. Function words and tokens of length less than 2 are ignored.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the strings are equal in the sense defined above

equalsCommonNorm

public static boolean equalsCommonNorm(java.lang.String s1,
                                       java.lang.String s2)
Compares the normalizations of the two strings, using the same criterion as the equalsCommon() method.

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the normalizations are equal

equalsCommonProp

public static boolean equalsCommonProp(java.lang.String s1,
                                       java.lang.String s2)
Compares two strings, using the same criterion as the equalsCommonNorm() method, but considers only words starting with a capital letter (proper nouns)

Parameters:
s1 - string 1
s2 - string 2
Returns:
true, iff the proper nouns are equal

replaceIgnoreCase

public static java.lang.String replaceIgnoreCase(java.lang.String s,
                                                 java.lang.String s1,
                                                 java.lang.String s2)
Replaces all substrings of s that match s1 with s2. This method is similar to String.replace(), but it ignores the case of s1.

Parameters:
s - the string
s1 - the substring to be replaced
s2 - the replacement for the substring
Returns:
modified string

sortByLength

public static void sortByLength(java.lang.String[] ss)

Sorts an array of strings by their length in ascending order.

This sort is guaranteed to be stable: strings of equal length are not reordered.

Parameters:
ss - array of strings

sortByLengthDesc

public static void sortByLengthDesc(java.lang.String[] ss)

Sorts an array of strings by their length in descending order.

This sort is guaranteed to be stable: strings of equal length are not reordered.

Parameters:
ss - array of strings
